org.perfcake.reporting.reporter

Class MemoryUsageReporter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.perfcake.reporting.reporter.AbstractReporter
      • org.perfcake.reporting.reporter.MemoryUsageReporter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Reporter

    public class MemoryUsageReporter
extends AbstractReporter
    Reports memory usage information from a remote JVM, where PerfCake agent is deployed. It communicates with the PerfCake agent to get the information via TCP sockets.
    Author:
    Pavel Mac√≠k

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Description copied from interface: Reporter
        Starts the reporter. After a call to this method, reporter will report measurement results to the registered destinations. All destinations are started as well.
        Specified by:
        start in interface Reporter
        Overrides:
        start in class AbstractReporter

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Description copied from interface: Reporter
        Stops the reporter. After a call to this method, no more results will be reported to the destinatons. All destinations are stopped as well.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface Reporter
        Overrides:
        stop in class AbstractReporter

      • publishResult

        public void publishResult(PeriodType periodType,
                          Destination destination)
                   throws ReportingException
        Description copied from interface: Reporter
        Publishes results to the destination. This method is called only when the results should be published.
        Parameters:
        periodType - A period type that caused the invocation of this method.
        destination - A destination to which the result should be reported.
        Throws:
        ReportingException - When it was not possible to publish results to the given destination.

      • getMemoryLeakSlopeThreshold

        public double getMemoryLeakSlopeThreshold()
        Gets the possible memory leak detection threshold. Possible memory leak is found, when the actual slope of the linear regression line computed from the time window data set is greater than the threshold.
        Returns:
        The memory leak slope threshold.

      • setMemoryLeakSlopeThreshold

        public MemoryUsageReporter setMemoryLeakSlopeThreshold(double memoryLeakSlopeThreshold)
        Sets the possible memory leak detection threshold. Possible memory leak is found, when the actual slope of the linear regression line computed from the time window data set is greater than the threshold.
        Parameters:
        memoryLeakSlopeThreshold - The memory leak slope threshold.
        Returns:
        Instance of this to support fluent API.

      • isMemoryLeakDetectionEnabled

        public boolean isMemoryLeakDetectionEnabled()
        Is the possible memory leak detection enabled?
        Returns:
        The memory leak detection status.

      • setMemoryLeakDetectionEnabled

        public MemoryUsageReporter setMemoryLeakDetectionEnabled(boolean memoryLeakDetectionEnabled)
        Enables/disables the possible memory leak detection mechanism.
        Parameters:
        memoryLeakDetectionEnabled - true to enable memory leak detection mechanism.
        Returns:
        Instance of this to support fluent API.

      • isMemoryDumpOnLeak

        public boolean isMemoryDumpOnLeak()
        Returns a value of the property to make a memory dump, when possible memory leak is detected. The MemoryUsageReporter will send a command to PerfCake agent that will create a heap dump.
        Returns:
        true if the memory dump on leak is enabled. false otherwise.

      • setMemoryDumpOnLeak

        public MemoryUsageReporter setMemoryDumpOnLeak(boolean memoryDumpOnLeak)
        Sets the value of the property to make a memory dump, when possible memory leak is detected. The MemoryUsageReporter will send a command to PerfCake agent that will create a heap dump.
        Parameters:
        memoryDumpOnLeak - Enables or disables the memory dump on leak.
        Returns:
        Instance of this to support fluent API.

      • isPerformGcOnMemoryUsage

        public boolean isPerformGcOnMemoryUsage()
        Returns the value of the property that indicate if performing garbage collection (each time the memory usage of the tested system is measured and published) is enabled or disabled.
        Returns:
        true if the garbage collection feature is enabled, false otherwise.

      • setPerformGcOnMemoryUsage

        public MemoryUsageReporter setPerformGcOnMemoryUsage(boolean performGcOnMemoryUsage)

        Enables/disables garbage collection to be performed each time the memory usage of the tested system is measured and published. Since the garbage collection is CPU intensive operation be careful to enable it and to how often the memory usage is measured because it will have a significant impact on the measured system and naturally the measured results too.

        It is disabled by default.

        Parameters:
        performGcOnMemoryUsage - true to enable the feature. The false otherwise.
        Returns:
        Instance of this to support fluent API.
